episodeTitle: Shaking Up the New World! Caesar's Horrendous Experiment!
description: Caesar reveals his sinister plan to the world as he broadcasts his weapon experiment. Law's vulnerability is exposed when Caesar reveals that Vergo holds Law's heart. Meanwhile, Smiley approaches a giant candy containing a deadly substance.

events.title: Mocha Regains Her Senses
events.description: Mocha begins resisting the addictive drug NHC10 and regains her memories of Nami and Usopp's rescue attempt. Despite withdrawal symptoms causing hallucinations, she realizes the Straw Hats were trying to save the children from Caesar.
events.significance: Marks the first time one of the kidnapped children breaks free from Caesar's drug control, setting up Mocha's eventual heroic sacrifice to protect the other children.

events.title: Caesar Reveals the Heart Swap Deal
events.description: Caesar reveals to Law that he knows all of Law's plans through Monet's surveillance. He thanks Law for naively giving him his heart in exchange for Monet's heart as part of their alliance agreement. Caesar shows that Vergo now possesses Law's heart while Caesar himself holds Smoker's heart.
events.significance: Reveals Law's critical vulnerability and the depth of Caesar and Doflamingo's manipulation. This explains why Law has been operating so carefully and sets up the dramatic tension for Law's eventual counterattack.

quotes.text: Thanks for naively giving me your heart in exchange for Monet's heart as part of our contract, Law!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar mocking Law for trusting him with his literal heart

events.title: Vergo Tortures Law by Squeezing His Heart
events.description: Vergo squeezes Law's physical heart, causing Law to scream and thrash in his restraints. When Law insults Caesar's intelligence, Caesar becomes enraged and grabs the heart himself, squeezing it until Law passes out from the pain.
events.significance: Demonstrates the horrifying effectiveness of Law's own Ope Ope no Mi powers being used against him. This brutal scene emphasizes how dangerous it is for Law to have his heart in enemy hands and showcases the sadistic nature of both Caesar and Vergo.

events.title: Caesar Begins Broadcasting to Underworld Brokers
events.description: Caesar commences a worldwide broadcast to weapons dealers and underworld brokers, preparing to demonstrate his new weapon of mass destruction. He explains his pet/weapon Smiley and the history of Punk Hazard's poisoning four years ago.
events.significance: Reveals the extent of the criminal underworld's arms trade and Caesar's ambitions to become the premier weapons dealer in the New World. This broadcast sets up the demonstration that will draw attention from major players in the underworld.

events.title: Caesar Explains Smiley's Origin
events.description: Caesar reveals that Smiley was created from the H2S poison gas bomb that nearly destroyed all life on Punk Hazard four years ago. He condensed the gas into slime form and fed it the Sara Sara no Mi, Model: Axolotl Devil Fruit, creating the living weapon Smiley.
events.significance: Explains the creation of one of the arc's major threats and reveals Caesar's role in the disaster that devastated Punk Hazard. This backstory connects to the island's tragic history and Caesar's expulsion from the government science team.

events.title: Nami (in Sanji's Body) Assists Usopp
events.description: Nami, still trapped in Sanji's body, awakens and helps the recovering Usopp. The body-swapped Straw Hats continue dealing with the complications of their switched forms.
events.significance: Continues the body swap subplot that adds comedic relief while also creating tactical complications for the Straw Hats during the Punk Hazard crisis.

events.title: Giant Candy Placed for Smiley
events.description: A massive candy containing the Shinokuni substance is placed in Smiley's path. Caesar explains this special bait will eliminate the one flaw from his weapon four years ago by transforming Smiley into an even more powerful weapon.
events.significance: Sets up the transformation of Smiley into Shinokuni, the petrifying poison gas that will become the arc's primary threat and force everyone on the island to flee or be turned to stone.

quotes.text: By feeding Smiley with special bait I prepared, the poisonous axolotl will transform into an improved weapon called Shinokuni!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown
quotes.context: Caesar explaining his experiment to the underworld brokers

events.title: Smiley Approaches the Giant Candy
events.description: Smiley, the massive poison slime creature, moves toward the giant candy while chasing Zoro's group. Upon seeing Caesar on the display screens, Smiley briefly pauses as Caesar attempts to demonstrate his control over the monster with commands.
events.significance: Shows the unpredictability of Smiley and Caesar's false confidence in controlling his creation. This moment foreshadows that Caesar's experiment may not go exactly as planned.

events.title: Smiley Devours the Candy
events.description: Ignoring Caesar's commands to wait, Smiley devours the massive piece of candy containing the Shinokuni substance. Caesar attempts to save face by acting as if this was according to plan in front of the watching brokers.
events.significance: Triggers the transformation that will create Shinokuni, the petrifying poison gas. This act of disobedience from Smiley reveals Caesar's lack of true control over his creations and begins the countdown to the island-wide catastrophe.

themes.description: Caesar's revelation of his deal with Law showcases the treacherous nature of alliances in the underworld. Law's vulnerability through his own Devil Fruit powers being used against him emphasizes the danger of trusting the wrong people.
themes.symbolism: The physical heart represents vulnerability and trust, with Caesar literally holding Law's life in his hands as a symbol of complete betrayal.

themes.description: The episode explores the ethics and horror of developing chemical weapons. Caesar's broadcast to arms dealers shows the dark side of the New World's power structure and the commodification of death.
themes.symbolism: Smiley represents the uncontrollable nature of weapons of mass destruction - even its creator cannot fully control it.
culturalReferences: References to real-world chemical weapons and arms dealing

themes.description: Mocha's struggle with withdrawal from the addictive drug NHC10 parallels themes of manipulation and control over vulnerable individuals, particularly children.
themes.symbolism: The candy represents false comfort and the insidious nature of addiction disguised as something appealing.

characterSpotlights.development: Caesar's villainy is fully exposed as he reveals his manipulation of Law, his cruel experiments on children, and his ambitions to profit from mass destruction. His sadistic nature is emphasized through his torture of Law and false sentimentality toward Smiley.

characterSpotlights.development: Law's vulnerability is exposed when Caesar reveals he holds Law's literal heart. Despite being tortured and humiliated, Law maintains his composure and continues to trust in his alliance with Luffy, showing his determination and strategic thinking even in dire circumstances.

Maintains faith in his plan despite setback

characterSpotlights.development: Mocha begins her transformation from drugged victim to hero as she fights through withdrawal to regain her senses and remember the Straw Hats' rescue attempt. Her hallucinations (seeing people with snake, frog, and lizard heads) emphasize the horror of what Caesar has done to the children.
keyActions: Regains memories of Nami and Usopp's rescue
Realizes the Straw Hats are trying to save the children

characterSpotlights.development: Vergo's sadistic nature and loyalty to Doflamingo are reinforced as he tortures Law by squeezing his heart. His calm demeanor while inflicting pain emphasizes his cold, professional cruelty.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded Mocha's hallucinations to include a person with a frog head and a person with a lizard head, in addition to the snake-headed person from the manga.
The anime added scenes of Monet serving coffee to Vergo, which was not shown in the manga.
Episode 601 corresponds primarily to Chapter 675, with some elements from the beginning of Chapter 676.

trivia.fact: This episode aired on June 23, 2013, during the Punk Hazard arc, which was the first arc of the Dressrosa Saga and marked the Straw Hats' first adventure in the New World after the two-year timeskip.
Ryūsei Nakao, who voices Caesar Clown, is famous for voicing Frieza in Dragon Ball Z. His high-pitched, menacing voice makes him perfect for mad scientist characters.
The opening theme 'Hands Up!' by Kota Shinzato was used for episodes 591-628, covering the entire Punk Hazard arc.
Toei Animation stopped producing ending themes for One Piece from Episode 279 to Episode 1070, which is why this episode has no ending song.

trivia.fact: The concept of Smiley being created by feeding a Devil Fruit to a non-living substance (poison gas) is similar to how objects like swords can 'eat' Devil Fruits through Vegapunk's technology.
